newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian small firms to pay lower withholding tax.
newsitem.headline: Belgian small firms to pay lower withholding tax.

text.p: Dividends paid on the shares of small and medium sized Belgian companies which get a listing on the Brussels bourse will enjoy a lower, 15 percent withholding tax on their entire share capital, the Belgian government said on Friday.
Belgium's standard withholding tax rate on share dividends is 25 percent, although an existing measure already lowers that tax to 15 percent for listed shares which originate from a capital increase.
The new measure aims at boosting the number of family-owned companies that go public, and is part of a large package of government measures in favour of small and medium sized companies.
The other measures include simplifying administrative procedures.
The government will also broaden the scope of action of its participation fund to share the risks that credit institutions take when giving loans to start up companies.
